name: CITY OF PHILADELPHIA, Appellant v. WORKERS' COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD (BOWERS), Appellee
name_abbreviation: City of Philadelphia v. Workers' Compensation Appeal Board

judges: Before ZAPPALA, C.J., and CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN, SAYLOR and EAKIN, JJ.
parties: CITY OF PHILADELPHIA, Appellant v. WORKERS’ COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD (BOWERS), Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Michael David Sehaff, Philadelphia, Charlene Stewart Barnoba, for appellant, City of Philadelphia.
James A. Holzman, Harrisburg, Amber Marie Kenger, Mechanicsburg, for appellee, W.C.A.B.
Thomas F. McDevitt, Philadelphia, Jack Famiglietti, for appellee, Francis W. Bowers.
casebody.head_matter:
795 A.2d 968
CITY OF PHILADELPHIA, Appellant v. WORKERS’ COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD (BOWERS), Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued April 9, 2002.
Decided April 26, 2002.
Michael David Sehaff, Philadelphia, Charlene Stewart Barnoba, for appellant, City of Philadelphia.
James A. Holzman, Harrisburg, Amber Marie Kenger, Mechanicsburg, for appellee, W.C.A.B.
Thomas F. McDevitt, Philadelphia, Jack Famiglietti, for appellee, Francis W. Bowers.
Before ZAPPALA, C.J., and CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN, SAYLOR and EAKIN, JJ.
